|blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1852449{{GR|3}} |website = |footnotes = }} '''Tselakai Dezza''' is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[San Juan County, Utah|San Juan County]], [[Utah]], [[United States]]. The population was 103 at the [[2000 United States Census|2000 census]]. ==Geography== Tselakai Dezza is located at {{Coord|37|12|40|N|109|35|20|W|type:city}} (37.211198, -109.588759).{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of 19.8 square miles (51.2 km²), all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 103 people, 28 households, and 25 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 5.2 people per square mile (2.0/km²). There were 38 housing units at an average density of 1.9/sq mi (0.7/km²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 99.03% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]] and 0.97% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]]. There were 28 households out of which 35.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 64.3% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 21.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 10.7% were non-families. 10.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 7.1% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.68 and the average family size was 3.92. In the CDP the population was spread out with 30.1% under the age of 18, 15.5% from 18 to 24, 24.3% from 25 to 44, 23.3% from 45 to 64, and 6.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 26 years. For every 100 females there were 90.7 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 84.6 males. The median income for a household in the CDP was $47,250, and the median income for a family was $47,250. Males had a median income of $100,000 versus $5,000 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $19,021. None of the population or families were below the [[poverty line]]. ==References== <references /> {{San Juan County, Utah}} {{Communities of the Navajo Nation}} [[Category:Populated places in San Juan County, Utah]] [[Category:Census-designated places in Utah]] [[Category:Populated places in Utah with Native American majority populations]] [[Category:Populated places on the Navajo Nation]]
